channel.title: Morning Agriculture
channel.description: Delivered every Monday by 10 a.m., Weekly Agriculture examines the latest news in agriculture and food politics and policy.

item.title: Farm labor reform takes center stage
item.description: The chairs and ranking members of Congress’ ag committees said reforming the H-2A visa program is front and center for 2026.
item.dc:creator: By Rachel Shin

item.title: Food policy’s January forecast
item.description: For January, nutrition policy is slated to be front and center.
item.dc:creator: By Rachel Shin

item.title: MAHA’s 2026 food agenda
item.description: The FDA’s deputy commissioner for human foods shares his agenda for next year.
item.dc:creator: By Grace Yarrow and Rachel Shin
item.dc:contributor: By Grace Yarrow and Rachel Shin

item.title: Lawmakers push for bird flu vaccine
item.description: A case of bird flu was detected in a dairy cattle herd Sunday amid a bipartisan push for USDA to accelerate review of a vaccine for the virus.
item.dc:creator: By Rachel Shin

item.title: Farmer bailout in sight
item.description: The Trump administration’s long-awaited farm bailout is due this week, and questions loom about who will benefit from the relief.
item.dc:creator: By Rachel Shin

item.title: Pennsylvania expects farm labor reform soon
item.description: The Pennsylvania Farm Bureau said House Ag Chair G.T. Thompson (R-Pa.) will likely introduce legislation that includes a pathway for hiring year-round migrant farmworkers.
item.dc:creator: By Rachel Shin

item.title: The problem with SNAP benefits cards
item.description: Some Republicans in Congress are weighing how to fix SNAP benefits “skimming,” which can cost hundreds of millions in taxpayer dollars.
item.dc:creator: By Marcia Brown

item.title: Parties jockey for farmers’ favor
item.description: With the midterms looming, Democrats and Republicans are already jockeying for the support of farmers and rural voters.
item.dc:creator: By Rachel Shin
